Then He made the two parts into thirds, so He placed me in the best of them a third, and that is His Almighty’s saying: So the companions of the right. And the Companions of Al-Mashama, and the Forerunners, for I am one of the Forerunners, and I am the best of the Forerunners. Then He made the thirds tribes, so He made me one of the best of them a tribe, and that is His saying: And We made you peoples and tribes that you may know one another. Indeed, the most honorable of you in the sight of God is the most pious of you. I am the most pious of the children of Adam and the most honorable of them before God, and I have no pride. Then He made the tribes into houses, and He made me one of the best of them into a house. That is what God Almighty says: God only desires to remove impurity from you, O People of the House, and to purify you with a thorough purification [Surat Al-Ahzab / 33, verse: 33]. 
And from the narration of Ibn Wahb - that he, peace be upon him, said: God Almighty said: Ask, O Muhammad. I said: What do I ask, Lord? You took Abraham as a friend, you spoke carefully to Moses, you chose Noah, and you gave Solomon a kingdom that no one after him should have. Then God Almighty said: I have not given you better than that. I have given you Al-Kawthar, and I have made your name with My name, it will be proclaimed in the depths of the heavens, and I have made the earth a purity for you and for your nation, and I have forgiven you for your past and future sins, so you walk among the people. Your intercession will be forgiven, and I did not do that to anyone before you. I made the hearts of your nation their Qur’an books, and I hid your intercession for you, and I did not hide it for any prophet other than you. Abu Muhammad Makki, Abu al-Layth al-Samarqandi and others narrated that when Adam disobeyed him, he said: O God, for the sake of Muhammad, forgive me my sin. It is narrated: Accept my repentance. Then God said to him: (How did you know Muhammad)? He said: I saw written in every place in Paradise: There is no god but God, and Muhammad is the Messenger of God, or: Muhammad is my servant and my messenger, so I knew that he was the most honorable of your creation to you. So God accepted his repentance and forgave him. This is when interpreting the Almighty’s saying: Then Adam received words from his Lord, and He turned to him. And in the narration of Al-Ajri, he said: Then Adam said, When you created me, I raised my head to your throne, and upon it was written: There is no god but God, and Muhammad is the Messenger of God. Then I knew that there is no one greater in status with you than the one whose name you have placed with yours, so God revealed to him: By My Might and Majesty, he is the last of the prophets of your descendants, and had it not been for him, I would not have created you.
On the authority of Ibn Abbas, he said: Some of the Companions of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, sat waiting for him. He said: So he went out until when he approached them, he heard them discussing, so he overheard their conversation, and some of them said: Wow! God took a friend from His creation. He took Abraham as a friend. Another said: What is more amazing than the words of Moses? God spoke to him carefully. Another said: Jesus was spoken to by God and his spirit. Another said: And Adam was chosen by God.
So he went out to them and greeted them, and said: I have heard your words and your astonishment, that God Almighty took Abraham as a friend, and he is like that, and Moses saved God, and he is like that, and Moses saved God, and he is like that, and Jesus is the spirit of God, and he is like that, and Adam was chosen by God, and he is like that. I am the lover of God and I am not proud, and I am the first to intercede and the first to intercede and he is like that. As for whoever moves the throat of Paradise, God will open for me and admit me into it. And with me are the poor believers and there is no pride. I honor the first and the last, and I am not proud. 
On the authority of Abu Hurairah, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: (God took Abraham as a friend, and Moses as a savior, and He took me as a lover. Then he said: By my glory, I will give preference to my beloved over my friend and my rescuer). With a simple comparison, it becomes clear that the Prophet Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace, was elevated above all the prophets and messengers (and We raised some of them above others in degrees) (Those messengers We favored some of them over others) How could it not be that he was their imam in the night journey in Al-Aqsa Mosque, which is the call of our father. Abraham and what was preached to Moses and Jesus, peace be upon them, Their laws were only a prelude to the conclusion of the messages and the prophecy of Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him. He said, “If Moses were with me, he would have no choice but to follow me.” And when Jesus, peace be upon him, descends, he will be one of the followers of our Master Muhammad, and he will pray behind the Imam as an indication of that.


Even if Arabs and non-Arabs were to weigh it - I would make his ransom for it - they would not have reached its weight
If the friend is mentioned, then he is a beloved --- God praised him in the Qur’an
And if they mention the Survival of the Mount, then remember --- the Survival of the Throne, lacking in singing
For God spoke to that person by revelation---and he spoke to that person by addressing and praising him
If you encounter the word "You will not see me" --- for "The heart does not lie", you will understand the meaning Moses fell unconscious --- and Ahmed was not going to lose his mind
And if they mentioned Solomon as a king --- then he gained treasures with him, as we have mentioned
So they showered Mecca with its father's gold - the kingdom will perish and pleasures will perish
And if David's armor were a garment, it would protect him from fear and a fortress
Muhammad’s shield of the Qur’an when he recited “And God will protect you” reassured us
And Noah drowned his people in the land with the call “Do not leave” anyone, and he was destroyed
And Ahmed’s call (Lord, guide my people) --- they do not know as we know
And all the messengers say “myself” --- and “Ahmad” means “my nation,” both human and jinn
And all the prophets are a source of guidance --- and you are the sun, the most perfect and best-guided among them Pictures of the greatness of the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace
Before we delve into some aspects of the Prophet’s greatness, we must say: What indicates the greatness of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, is the many names and attributes. Some of them said: He gave him two of his names: Compassionate and Merciful. 
Al-Hussein bin Al-Fadl said: God did not combine two of His names for any of the prophets except for the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, for he said about himself (Indeed, God is compassionate and merciful to people) Al-Hajj 65, and he said about the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, He described (to the believers Compassionate and Merciful) Al-Tawbah 128. On the authority of Jubayr bin Mutim, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: I have names. I am Muhammad, I am Ahmad, and I am Al-Mahi through whom God erases disbelief. I am Al-Hashir at whose feet people will be gathered, and I am Al-Aqib after whom there will be no prophet. On the authority of Hudhayfah, he said: I met the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, on some of the roads of Medina, and he said: I am Muhammad, I am Ahmad, I am a prophet of mercy, and I am a prophet of Repentance, and I am the rhyme, and I am the Gatherer, and the Prophet of epics. When Muhammad, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was trying to win over the leaders of the Quraish tribe, and during his conversation with them, Abdullah bin Umm Maktoum, who was Basir, tried to ask about something important from the matters of Islam, but the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, turned away from him. The Qur’an rebuked the Prophet Muhammad in Surah (Abas) for turning away from him and turning his face to the bed of disbelief out of his desire to enter Islam. The Qur’an considered that there was no need for him to wish for them to enter Islam, but the Muslims who came to you are more deserving of this concern. , What do you know, O Muhammad, that this infidel will be purified and enter Islam? He is in the knowledge of the unseen, and the matter is entrusted to God. Another incident similar to this occurred when the infidels of Quraysh and their clans agreed in principle with the Messenger that he would make a day for them to sit with him and that he would make a special day for the poor and slaves, and this was a condition for their faith. The Messenger’s heart was almost inclined to this proposal, so his Lord rebuked him for that and asked him to abandon this proposal, for the Muslims were equal like the teeth of a comb. And God Almighty said in this reproach (You had almost left something to them.) a little, Then We would have made you taste the double of life and the double of death.) In these two cases, the Prophet did not conceal the revelation that came down to him, and this is clear evidence of his greatness.

And another picture of his greatness: When his wife Aisha, the Mother of the Believers, asked him about Khadija, did God not compensate you with something better than her? He answered her: No, she was the one who believed in him and believed him when people rejected him and were hostile to him! He did not give in to jealousy and did not try to deceive her or flatter her. This is his greatness, may God bless him and grant him peace.

When the Messenger of God was given the choice of whether our Prophet would be a king or a servant a prophet, he chose to be a servant a prophet because of the honor and honor that comes in the position of slavery. God Almighty said while attributing it to Himself: “Glory be to Him who took His servant by night from the Sacred Mosque to the Mosque.” Al-Aqsa” indicates his rejection of the choice of king by God Almighty. The infidels of Quraish once offered him kingship, prestige, authority, money, wealth, and leadership over them, and even over all the Arabs, in exchange for abandoning the Islamic call and returning to their misguided gods. They said their famous saying: If you want money, we will collect money for you and make you the richest man among us, and if you want kingship, we will make you king over us and make the matter yours, and if you are possessed by the jinn or an illness that cannot be cured, we will treat you until you are cured of this illness. So he rejected all of that and rejected all those false temptations. Which only tempts the weak of heart and those with corrupt minds who rely on this world and its pleasures and forget the Hereafter and what is in it. The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said his famous saying, which history remembers of him, with all its light, illumination, guidance, and mercy. He said to his uncle Abu Talib, “O uncle, by God, if they put the moon on my right and the sun on my left on condition that I leave this matter, I will not leave it until God makes it victorious or I perish without Him.” It is a statement that chills the skin and humbles the hearts, the statement of a man confident in the victory of his Lord, confident and believing in what he conveys from his Lord that God will support this religion and raise up His banner, even if the disbelievers hate it. This great prophet was worthy of receiving all love, all appreciation, all respect, and all reverence from all those who followed him, believed in him, and followed the light he brought, and all those who did not believe in him.

An example of his greatness is what Ibn Majah narrated in his Sunan on the authority of Qais bin Abi Hazim: A man came to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and he stood before him, but a tremor seized him, so the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: (Take it easy, for I am not a king. Rather, I am the son of a woman from Quraysh who used to eat porridge.)
Yes, this humility is part of the greatness of the Messenger, may the best prayers and peace be upon him. Who can forget the great situation when the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, entered Mecca as a conqueror and said to its people after they had harmed and tortured him: What do you think I will do to you? They said: A generous brother and a generous nephew. He said to them: Go, you are free.

This man succeeded in his life, and his success continued after his death at the hands of his followers. He created heroes. It is the school of Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace, that produced heroes and preachers who traveled the earth, east and west, to spread God’s religion and light and convey it to people. The greatest position indicative of the greatness of the men he created in his life was their position upon his death, when Abu Bakr, unaffected by this news, went to the Messenger of God after he heard of his death and went out to the Muslims and said, “O people, whoever worships Muhammad, then Muhammad is dead, and whoever worships God, then God is alive and does not die.” He read the Almighty’s saying, “And Muhammad is no more than a messenger. Messengers have passed away before him. But if he dies or is killed, will you turn back on your heels?”
Therefore, it is not surprising that Michael Hart, in his book The 100 Greats, placed him at the forefront. Michael said about the reason for his choice of Muhammad and his being the greatest, so he said: (My choosing Muhammad to lead the list of the world’s most influential people on humanity may surprise some readers, and some may object to it.. But he (i.e. Muhammad) was the only man in history who achieved outstanding success on both the religious and worldly levels.
One Western thinker said about him that if Muhammad had been given the reins in this world full of circumstances and problems, he would have led humanity to safety.
“Indeed there has been for you in the Messenger of God a good example.” (Al-Ahzab: 21)
We can now conclude why God said to Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace, “And We raise up your remembrance” (Al-Sharh: 44). There are many sayings of the Orientalists in acknowledging his greatness, including: From the book The Greatness of Muhammad by Ahmed Deedat
1- “Muhammad (may God bless him and grant him peace) was compassionate and kind in her eyes, and those around him felt his influence and never forgot him.” Diwan Chandharma. Hindu researcher, in his book Messengers of the East in 1935, p. 122.
2- “Born in Mecca in the Arabian Peninsula in the year 569 AD - and four years after the death of Justinian I - the man who had the greatest influence on the human race of all men, Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace.” John William Drew, a physician and doctor of laws, in his book “The History of European Intellectual Development.” London 1875.
3- “I doubt that any human being does not change despite the great changes in his external circumstances, just as Muhammad did not change, in order to fit and agree with these changes.” R. F. K. Bodley in “Al-Rasul Newspaper,” London, 1946, p. 6.
4- “I have studied the wonderful man and in my opinion he should be called the savior of humanity, as he is far from being called the Antichrist.” George Bernard Shaw in (True Islam), Part 1, 1936.
5- “Fortunately, it is absolutely unique in history that Muhammad is the founder of three things: the nation, the empire, and the religion.” R. Bosworth-Smith in the book Muhammad and Muhammadiyah in 1946.
6- “Muhammad was the most successful of all religious figures.” Encyclopædia Britannica. If greatness of purpose, scarcity of means, and astonishing results are the three measures of human genius, then who dares to compare any great man in history to Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace?
Wise man - preacher - messenger - legislator - warrior - defeater of false ideas - reviver of rational beliefs and worship without idols or images - founder of 20 worldly empires and one spiritual empire. That is Muhammad. Considering all the standards by which human greatness can be measured, we have the right to ask: Is there any human being greater than him? certainly .... no .
He is “one man against all men,” who, with God’s victory for him, the sincerity of his resolve, and sincerity in his calling, was able to stand before everyone to refute falsehood and reveal the truth, so that God would establish the truth with His words, even if the disbelievers disliked it.
This great man who was able to stand before the entire world, before the ignorance of the Quraysh and their stubborn disbelief, before idols, the worship of the stars, and everything that is worshiped other than God, and he stood calling for God alone with no partner and rejecting everything else, is truly deserving of all reverence and respect, not only from his followers, but from all those who understand genius and its characteristics. The qualities that were unique in this great Messenger deserved him to receive a medal of distinction and receive all appreciation and respect. He is truly the greatest Messenger.
Is there any man greater than him after that? “No, there is no greater man than him. He lived his entire life in the service of all humanity and brought the final and happy religion to all humanity.
This great man is Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace. He is truly a man like whom humanity has never produced.

number: حبيبة رسول الله - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم
label:
1- التعريف بها: هِيَ أمُّ المؤمنينَ أمُّ عبدِالله: عائشةُ بنتُ الإمام الصِّدِّيق الأكْبر، خليفةِ رسولِ الله - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - أبِي بَكْرٍ عبدِالله بنِ أبي قُحَافةَ عثمانَ بنِ عامرِ بن عمرو بن كعْب بن سعْد بن تَيْم بن مُرَّة، بن كعْب بن لُؤيٍّ; القرشيَّة التيميَّة، المكيَّة، النبويَّة، أم المؤمنين، زَوْجة النبيِّ - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - أفْقَه نِساءِ الأُمَّة على الإطلاق.
وأمُّها هي: أُمُّ رُومانَ بنتُ عامرِ بن عُوَيمر، بن عبدِ شمْس، بن عتاب ابن أُذينة الكِنانية.
هاجَر بعائشةَ أبواها، وتزوَّجها نبيُّ الله - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - قبل مهاجرِه بعدَ وفاة الصِّدِّيقة خديجة بنت خُوَيلد، وذلك قبلَ الهِجرة ببضعة عشَرَ شهرًا، وقيل: بعامين، ودخَل بها في شوَّال سَنةَ اثنتين منصرفَه - عليه الصلاة والسلام - مِن غزوةِ بدر، وهي ابنةُ تِسْع، فرَوَتْ عنه عِلمًا كثيرًا طيبًا مباركًا فيه، وعن أبيها، وعن عمر، وفاطمة، وسعْد، وحمْزَة بن عمرو الأسْلمي، وجُدَامَةَ بنتِ وهْب..\" [1].

2- حبُّ النبيِّ - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - لها: اختارَها الله لنبيِّه، حيثُ رآها في المنام، كما جاء في الصحيحَيْن - واللَّفْظ لمسلِم - عن عائشةَ قالتْ: قال رسولُ الله - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم -: ((أُريتكِ في المنام ثلاثَ ليالٍ، جاءَني بكِ المَلَك في سَرَقةٍ (قطعة) مِن حريرٍ، فيقول: هذه امرأتُك، فأَكْشِف عن وجْهِكِ، فإذا أنتِ هي، فأقول: إنْ يَكُ هذا مِن عندَ الله يُمضِه)).
وعن عمرِو بن العاص - رضي الله عنه - قال: بعَثَني رسولُ الله - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - على جيشِ ذاتِ السلاسل، قال: فأتيتُه قال: قلتُ: يا رسولَ الله، أيُّ الناس أحبُّ إليك؟ قال: ((عائشة))، قال: قلت: فمِن الرِّجال؟ قال: ((أبوها إذًا))، قال: قلت: ثُمَّ مَن؟ قال: ((عمر))، قال: فعدَّ رِجالاً\"؛ أخرجه الشيخان.

3- دعاءُ النبيِّ - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - لها: عن عائشةَ قالت: لمَّا رأيتُ مِن النبي - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - طِيبَ النَّفْس قلت: يا رسولَ الله، ادعُ اللهَ لي، فقال: ((اللهمَّ اغفرْ لعائشةَ ما تقدَّم مِن ذنبِها وما تأخَّر، وما أسَرَّتْ وما أعْلَنتْ))، فضحِكتْ عائشةُ حتى سقَط رأسها في حجْرِ رسولِ الله - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - من الضحِك، فقال: ((أيَسرُّكِ دُعائي؟))، فقالت: وما لي لا يَسرُّني دعاؤك؟! فقال: ((واللهِ إنَّها لدَعْوَتي))؛ أخرجه البزَّار في مسنده، وحَسَّنه الألباني.

4- ثناءُ النبي - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - وصحابته عليها: عن أبي موسى الأشعريِّ - رضي الله عنه - قال: قالَ رسولُ اللَّهِ - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم -: ((كَمَلَ منَ الرِّجال كثيرٌ، ولم يَكْمُلْ منَ النِّساءِ إلاَّ مريمُ بنتُ عِمرانَ، وآسِيةُ امرأةُ فِرعونَ، وفضْلُ عائشةَ على النِّساءِ كفَضْل الثَّرِيدِ على سائرِ الطعام))؛ صحيح البخاري.

وعَنْ عَائِشَةَ - رضِي الله عنها - قَالَتْ: قال - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - يَوْمًا: ((يا عائِشَ، هَذا جبْريلُ يُقْرِئُكِ السَّلاَم))، فَقُلْتُ: وَعليه السلام ورحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وبَرَكاتُه، تَرَى ما لا أَرى - تُرِيدُ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ، صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم؛ رواه الشيخان - البخاريُّ ومسلم. 
وعن الحَكمِ: سمعتُ أبا وائلٍ قال: \"لَمَّا بعَثَ عليٌّ عَمَّارًا والحسنَ إلى الكوفَة؛ ليستَنفِرَهم، خَطبَ عمَّارٌ فقال: إنِّي لأعلمُ أنَّها زوجتُهُ في الدُّنيا والآخِرة، ولكنَّ اللَّهَ ابتَلاكم؛ لتتبعوهُ أو إيَّاها\"؛ رواه البخاري.
وعَنْ أَنَسِ بن مالكٍ - رضي الله عنه - قال: سَمِعْتُ رَسولَ اللَّهِ - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - يَقولُ: ((فَضْلُ عائِشَةَ على النِّساءِ كَفَضْلِ الثَّرِيدِ على الطَّعام))؛ رواه الشيخان - البخاري ومسلم.

5- عبادتها وزُهدها: وقد كانتْ أُمُّ المؤمنين كثيرةَ الصيام، حتى ضعُفت، كما جاء في السِّيَر للذهبي - رحمه الله تعالى - عن عبدِالرحمن بن القاسِم، عن أبيه: أنَّ عائشةَ كانتْ تصوم الدَّهْر. 
كما كانتْ زاهدةً في الدنيا، فعَنْها قالت: \"ما شَبِع آلُ محمَّد يومَيْن من خُبزِ بُرٍّ إلا وأحدهما تَمْر\"؛ متفق عليه.
وعن عطاء: أنَّ معاويةَ بعَث إلى عائشةَ بقِلادةٍ بمائةِ ألْف، فقسمتْها بيْن أمَّهات المؤمنين، وعن عُروةَ، عن عائشة: أنَّها تصدَّقتْ بسَبْعِين ألفًا; وإنَّها لتُرقِّع جانبَ دِرْعها - رضي الله عنها.
وعن أُمِّ ذَرَّة، قالت: بعَث ابنُ الزبير إلى عائشةَ بمالٍ في غِرَارتَيْن، يكون مائة ألْف، فدَعَتْ بطَبق، فجعَلتْ تقسم في الناس، فلمَّا أمسَت، قالت: هاتِي يا جاريةُ فُطوري، فقالت أمُّ ذَرَّة: يا أمَّ المؤمنين، أمَا استطعتِ أن تشتري لنا لحمًا بدِرْهم؟! قالت: لا تُعنِّفيني، لو أذْكْرِتني لفعلتُ[2]. 

6- فِقهُ وعِلم أمِّ المؤمنين عائشة - رضي الله عنها -: قال الزُّهريُّ: لو جُمِع عِلمُ عائشة إلى عِلمِ جميعِ النساء، لكان علمُ عائشةَ أفْضلَ[3]. 
كما أنَّ الله قد وهَبَها الذكاءَ والفِطنة، وسُرعةَ الحافظة، قال ابن كثير: \"لم يَكُن في الأُممِ مثلُ عائشةَ في حِفْظها وعِلْمها، وفصاحتِها وعَقْلِها\"، ويقول الذهبيُّ: \"أفْقَهُ نِساء الأمَّة على الإطلاق، ولا أعْلمُ في أمَّة محمَّد، بل ولا في النِّساء مطلقًا امرأةً أعلمَ منها\".
وقدْ تجاوز عددُ الأحاديث التي روتْها ألْفَيْن ومائة حديث عن النبيِّ - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - وهي مُشتَهِرة في كُتُب السُّنَّة: البخاري ومسلم، والسُّنن والمسانيد، وغيرها؛ قال الحافظُ الذهبيُّ: مُسْنَد عائشة يبلُغ ألْفَين ومائتين وعشرة أحاديث؛ اتَّفق البخاريُّ ومسلمٌ لها على مائةٍ وأربعةٍ وسبعين حديثًا، وانفرَد البخاريُّ بأربعةٍ وخمسين، وانفرد مسلِمٌ بتِسعة وستِّين[4].
ويقول عُروةُ بنُ الزُّبَيْر: \"ما رأيتُ أحدًا أعلمَ بفِقه، ولا بِطبٍّ ولا بِشِعر من عائشةَ - رضي الله عنها\"، وقال فيها أبو عُمرَ بنُ عبدالبرِّ: \"إنَّ عائشةَ كانتْ وحيدةً بعصرها في ثلاثةِ علوم: علم الفقه، وعلم الطب، وعلم الشِّعر\".
كما كانتِ المرجعَ الكبيرَ لكِبار الصحابة، خاصَّة عندَ المواقف والملمَّات، كما كانتْ تُفتي بما لدَيْها من عِلمٍ وفِقه في عهد الخليفةِ عمرَ وعثمانَ - رضي الله عنهما - إلى أن تُوفِّيت - رحمها الله ورضي عنها.

7- نزول برائتِها مِن حادثة الإفْك من عندَ الله تعالى: وقدْ تعرَّضَتْ - رضِي الله عنها - إلى ابتلاءٍ شديد، وفِتْنةٍ كبيرة، حيث طَعَن في شرَفِها وعِرْضها المنافقون في المدينة، فأنْزَل الله براءتَها من فوقِ سبعِ سموات، وقد قالتْ - رضي الله عنها - كما في الصحيحين: \"... ثُمَّ تحولتُ واضطجعتُ على فِراشي، والله يعلم أنِّي حينئذٍ بريئةٌ، وأنَّ الله مُبرِّئي ببراءتي، ولكن واللهِ ما كنتُ أظنُّ أنَّ الله منزلٌ في شأني وحيًا يُتْلَى، لشأني في نفْسي كان أحْقرَ مِن أن يتكلَّم الله فيَّ بأمْر، ولكن كنتُ أرْجو أن يرَى رسولُ الله - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - في النومِ رُؤيَا يُبرِّئني الله بها، فواللهِ ما رام رسولُ الله - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - مجلسَه، ولا خرَج أحدٌ مِنْ أهل البيت حتَّى أُنزِل عليه، فأخَذَه ما كان يأخُذُه من البُرَحَاء، حتى إنَّه ليتحدَّر منْه مِن العَرَق مثل الجُمَان، وهو في يومٍ شاتٍ مِن ثِقَلِ القوْل الذي أُنزِل عليه.
قالت: فَسُرِّي عن رسولِ الله - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - وهو يَضْحَك، فكانتْ أوَّل كَلمةٍ تَكلَّم بها أنْ قال: ((يا عائشةُ، أمَّا اللهُ فقدْ بَرَّأكِ))، قالت: فقالتْ لي أُمِّي: قُومِي إليه، فقلتُ: واللهِ لا أقومُ إليه، فإنِّي لا أحْمَدُ إلاَّ اللهَ - عزَّ وجلَّ.
قالت: وأنزَل الله تعالى: ﴿ إِنَّ الَّذِينَ جَاءُوا بِالْإِفْكِ عُصْبَةٌ مِنْكُمْ ﴾ [النور: 11] الآيات...\". 
قال ابنُ كثير: \"فغار اللهُ لها وأنْزَلَ براءتَها في عشْر آياتٍ تُتلى على الزمان، فسَمَا ذِكْرُها، وعلا شأنُها؛ لتسمعَ عفافَها وهي في صِباها، فشَهِدَ الله لها بأنَّها مِنَ الطَّيِّبات، ووعدَها بمغفرةٍ ورِزق كريم\". 
ومَع هذه المنزِلَةِ العالية، والتبرِئة العالية الزكيَّة مِنَ الله تعالى، تَتَواضَعُ وتقول: \"ولَشَأنِي في نفْسي أهونُ مِن أن يُنزِل الله فيَّ قرآنًا يُتْلَى\"! 

8- خصائص أمِّ المؤمنين - رضي الله عنها -: قال ابنُ القيِّم - رحمه الله -: 
ومِن خصائصها: أنَّها كانتْ أحبَّ أزواج رسولِ الله - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - إليه، كما ثبَت عنْه ذلك في البخاريِّ وغيره، وقد سُئِل: أيُّ الناس أحبُّ إليك؟ قال: ((عائشة))، قيل: فمِن الرِّجال؟ قال: ((أبوها)). 
ومِن خصائصها أيضًا: أنَّه لَمْ يتزوَّج امرأةً بِكرًا غيرها، ومن خصائصها: أنَّه كان يَنزِل عليه الوحيُ وهو في لحافِها دونَ غيرِها، ومِن خصائصها: أنَّ الله - عزَّ وجلَّ - لَمَّا أنزل عليه آيةَ التخيير بدأ بها فخيَّرها، فقال: ((ولا عليكِ ألاَّ تَعْجَلي حتى تستأمري أَبَوَيك))، فقالت: أفِي هذا أسْتَأمِر أبوي؟! فإنِّي أُريد اللهَ ورسولَه والدارَ الآخِرة، فاستنَّ بها - أي: اقتَدَى - بقيةُ أزواجه - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - وقُلْنَ كما قالتْ.
ومِن خصائصها: أنَّ الله سبحانه برَّأها ممَّا رماها به أهلُ الإفك، وأنْزَل في عُذرِها وبراءتِها وحيًا يُتْلَى في محاريبِ المسلمين وصلواتهم إلى يومِ القيامة، وشَهِد لها بأنَّها مِنَ الطيِّبات، ووعَدَها المغفرةَ والرِّزقَ الكريم، وأخْبَر سبحانه أنَّ ما قيل فيها مِنَ الإفك كان خيرًا لها، ولم يكن ذلك الذي قيل فيها شَرًّا لها، ولا عائبًا لها، ولا خافضًا مِن شأنها، بل رَفَعها الله بذلك وأعْلى قدْرَها، وأعْظَمَ شأنها، وصار لها ذِكرًا بالطيب والبراءة بيْن أهلِ الأرض والسماء، فيا لها مِن مَنْقَبة ما أجلَّها! 
ومِن خصائِصها - رضي الله عنها -: أنَّ الأكابرَ مِنَ الصحابة - رضي الله عنهم - كان إذا أَشْكَل عليهم أمرٌ مِن الدِّين استفتوها فيَجِدون عِلمَه عندَها.
ومِن خصائصها - رضي الله عنها -: أنَّ رسولَ الله - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - تُوفِّي في بيتها، وفي يومِها، وبيْن سَحْرِها ونَحْرها، ودُفِن في بيتها.
ومِن خصائصها - رضي الله عنها -: أنَّ الناسَ كانوا يتحرَّوْن بهداياهم يومَها مِن رسولِ الله - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - تقربًا إلى الرسولِ - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - فيُتْحفونَه بما يحبُّ في منزلِ أحبِّ نسائِه إليه - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم ورضي الله عنهنَّ أجمعين[5].

وقال الإمام بدرُ الدِّين الزَّرْكشيُّ في \"الإجابة لإيراد ما استدركتْه عائشةُ على الصحابة\" - وهو يَتكلَّم في خصائصها، رضي الله عنها - الأربعين، قال: \"والخامِسة - أي: مِن الخصائص -: نزول براءتِها منَ السماء بما نَسَبه إليها أهلُ الإفك في ستَّ عشرةَ آية متوالية، وشَهِد لها بأنَّها من الطيِّبات، ووعَدها بالمغفرةِ والرِّزق الكريم، قال: والسادس: جَعله قُرآنًا يُتْلَى إلى يومِ القيامة؛ أي: الآيات التي نزلَتْ في براءتِها. 
وقال - في العاشرة -: وجوب محبَّتِها على كلِّ أحد، ففي الصحيح: لمَّا جاءتْ فاطمة - رضي الله عنها - إلى النبيِّ - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم - قال لها: ((ألسْتِ تُحبِّين ما أُحبُّ؟)) قالت: بلى، قال: ((فأَحبِّي هذه - يعني: عائشة))، وهذا الأمْرُ ظاهِرُه الوجوب. 
وقال - في الحادية عشرة -: إنَّ مَن قذَفها فقَدْ كفَر؛ لتصريحِ القرآن الكريم ببراءتِها، وقال - في الثانية عشرة -: مَن أنْكَر كونَ أبيها أبي بَكْرٍ الصِّدِّيق - رضي الله عنه - صحابيًّا كان كافرًا، نصَّ عليه الشافعيُّ، فإنَّ الله تعالى يقول: ﴿ إِذْ هُمَا فِي الْغَارِ إِذْ يَقُولُ لِصَاحِبِهِ لَا تَحْزَنْ إِنَّ اللَّهَ مَعَنَا ﴾ [التوبة: 40]، ومُنكِر صُحْبةِ غير الصَّدِّيق يَكْفُر لتكذيبه التواتُر[6]؛ انتهى مختصرًا.

9- وفاتها - رضي الله عنها -: تُوفِّيت - رضي الله عنها وأرْضاها - سَنةَ سَبْعٍ وخمسين على الصحيحِ، وقيل: سَنَة ثمان وخمسين، في ليلةِ الثلاثاء لسَبْعَ عشرةَ خَلَتْ مِن رمضان بعدَ الوتر، ودُفنت من ليلتها، وصلَّى عليها أبو هريرة، بعدَ أن عمرتْ ثلاثًا وستين سَنَة وأشهرًا - كما ذَكَر الذهبيُّ في \"السِّير\"[7]. 

10- حُكم الإسلام فيمَن سبَّ أمَّ المؤمنين عائشة - رضي الله عنها -: قال تعالى في تزكيةِ أمِّ المؤمنين ومكانتِها وغيرِها من زوجاتِ النبيِّ - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم -: ﴿ النَّبِيُّ أَوْلَى بِالْمُؤْمِنِينَ مِنْ أَنْفُسِهِمْ وَأَزْوَاجُهُ أُمَّهَاتُهُمْ ﴾[الأحزاب: 6]. 
وقدْ أجْمَع علماءُ الإسلام قاطبةً مِن أهل السُّنَّة والجماعة على أنَّ مَن سبَّ أمَّ المؤمنين عائشة - رضي الله عنها - ورَماها بما برَّأها الله منه أنه كافِرٌ، ورُوي عن مالكِ بن أنس أنَّه قال: مَن سَبَّ أبا بكرٍ وعُمرَ جُلِد، ومَن سَبَّ عائشةَ قُتِل، قيل له: لِمَ يقتلُ في عائشة؟ قال مالك: فمَن رماها فقدْ خالَفَ القرآن، ومَن خالف القرآنَ قُتِل. 
قال أبو مُحمَّد ابنُ حزْم الظاهريُّ - رحمه الله-: قول مالك هذا صحيحٌ، وهي رِدَّة تامَّة، وتكذيبٌ لله تعالى في قَطْعِه ببراءتها.
وقال أبو الخطَّابِ ابنُ دِحية في أجوبة المسائل: وشَهِد لقول مالك كتابُ الله، فإنَّ الله إذا ذَكَر في القرآن ما نَسَبه إليه المشرِكون سبَّح نفسَه لنفسِه، قال تعالى: ﴿ وَقَالُوا اتَّخَذَ الرَّحْمَنُ وَلَدًا سُبْحَانَهُ ﴾ [الأنبياء: 26]، والله تعالى ذَكَر عائشةَ، فقال: ﴿ وَلَوْلَا إِذْ سَمِعْتُمُوهُ قُلْتُمْ مَا يَكُونُ لَنَا أَنْ نَتَكَلَّمَ بِهَذَا سُبْحَانَكَ هَذَا بُهْتَانٌ عَظِيمٌ ﴾ [النور: 16]، فسبَّح نفْسَه في تنزيهِ عائشةَ، كمَا سبَّح نفسَه لنفسِه في تنزيهه؛ حكاه القاضي أبو بكر ابن الطيِّب[8]. 
وقال أبو بكر ابنُ زياد النيسابوريُّ: سَمعتُ القاسمَ بنَ محمَّد يقول لإسماعيلَ بن إسحاقَ: أُتِي المأمون في (الرَّقة) برَجلين شَتَم أحدُهما فاطمةَ، والآخَرُ عائشةَ، فأمَر بقَتْل الذي شتَم فاطمةَ وترَك الآخَر، فقال إسماعيلُ: ما حُكْمُهما إلاَّ أن يُقتلاَ؛ لأنَّ الذي شتَم عائشةَ ردَّ القرآن. 

قال شيخُ الإسلام ابنُ تيمية - رحمه الله - تعقيبًا عليه: وعلى هذا مضَتْ سِيرةُ أهل الفِقه والعِلم مِن أهل البيت وغيرِهم.
وقالَ ابنُ العربيِّ - رحمه الله -: كلُّ مَن سبَّها بما برَّأها الله منه فهو مُكذِّب لله، ومَن كذَّب الله فهو كافِر.
وقال ابن قُدامة: فمَن قذَفها بما بَرَّأها الله منه فقدْ كفَر بالله العظيم.
وقال الإمامُ النوويُّ - رحمه الله -: براءةُ عائشة - رضي الله عنها - مِنَ الإفْك، وهي براءةٌ قطعية بنصِّ القرآن العزيز، فلو تَشكَّك فيها إنسانٌ - والعياذ بالله - صار كافرًا مرتدًّا بإجماعِ المسلمين. 
وقال ابنُ القيِّم - رحمه الله -: واتَّفقتِ الأُمَّة على كُفْر قاذفِها.
وقد رُوِي عَنْ عَمْرِو بنِ غالِبٍ: أنَّ رَجُلاً نالَ مِنْ عائِشَةَ عندَ عَمَّارٍ، فقالَ: اغْرُبْ مَقْبوْحًا، أَتُؤذِي حَبِيبةَ رَسُول الله - صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم؟! قال الذهبيُّ في السِّيَر: صحَّحَه الترمذيُّ في بعضِ النُّسخ، وفي بعضِ النُّسخ قال: هذا حديثٌ حسَن.
number-en: Beloved of the Messenger of God - may God bless him and grant him peace
label-en:
1- Introduction to her: She is the Mother of the Believers, Umm Abdullah: Aisha, daughter of Imam Al-Siddiq Al-Akbar, successor to the Messenger of God - may God bless him and grant him peace - Abu Bakr Abdullah bin Abi Quhafa Othman bin Amer bin Amr bin Kaab bin Saad bin Taym bin Murrah, bin Kaab bin Louay; The Taymiyyah Qurayshi, the Meccan, the Prophet, the Mother of the Believers, the wife of the Prophet - may God bless him and grant him peace - the most jurist of the nation’s women ever.
Her mother is: Umm Ruman bint Amer bin Uwaimer, bin Abd Shams, bin Attab bin Udhaynah Al-Kinaniya. Her parents emigrated with Aisha, and the Prophet of God - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - married her before his emigrant, after the death of the truthful Khadija bint Khuwaylid, and that was a few months before the migration, or it was said: two years, and he entered into marriage with her in Shawwal of the year two of him - peace and blessings be upon him - from the Battle of Badr, and she was nine years old. She narrated a lot of good and blessed knowledge from him, and from her father, and from Omar, and Fatima, and Saad, and Hamza bin Amr Al-Aslami, and Judama bint Wahb...” [1]. 2- The love of the Prophet - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - for her: God chose her for His Prophet, as he saw her in a dream, as stated in the two Sahih books - and the wording is by Muslim - on the authority of Aisha, who said: The Messenger of God - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - said: ((I showed you in a dream for three nights, the king brought you to me in a stolen (piece) of silk, Then he says: This is your wife, so reveal your face, and it is you. Then I say: If this is from God, He will pass it on.” On the authority of Amr bin Al-Aas - may God be pleased with him - he said: The Messenger of God - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - sent me to the army of Dhat Al-Silsil. He said: So I came to him. He said: I said: O Messenger of God, which people do I love most to you? He said: ((Aisha)). He said: I said: Who are the men? He said: ((Her father then)) He said: I said: Then who? He said: ((Omar)). He said: So he counted some men. Narrated by the two sheikhs. 3- The Prophet’s supplication - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - for her: On the authority of Aisha, she said: When I saw that the Prophet - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - had a good soul, I said: O Messenger of God, pray to God for me, and he said: ((O God, forgive Aisha’s past and future sins, what she concealed and what she declared)). Aisha laughed until her head fell into the lap of the Messenger of God - may God bless him and grant him peace - from laughter, and he said: ((Does my supplication please you?)), so she said: What is the matter with me that your supplication does not please me?! He said: ((By God, it is my calling)) It was included by Al-Bazzar in his Musnad, and Al-Albani graded it hasan. 4- Praise of the Prophet - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - and his companions for it: On the authority of Abu Musa Al-Ash’ari - may God be pleased with him - he said: The Messenger of God - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - said: ((Many of the men were perfect, but none of the women were perfect except Maryam bint Imran, and Asiya, the wife of Pharaoh, and Fadl Aisha over women is like the surplus of porridge over other food.) Sahih Al-Bukhari. On the authority of Aisha - may God be pleased with her - she said: One day he - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - said: ((O Aisha, this is Gabriel reciting the greeting to you)), so I said: May the peace, mercy, and blessings of God be upon him, you see what I do not see - You want the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace; Narrated by the two sheikhs - Al-Bukhari and Muslim. And about Al-Hakam: I heard Abu Wael say: “When Ali sent Ammar and Al-Hasan to Kufa to mobilize them, Ammar proposed to him and said: I know that she is his wife in this world and the hereafter, but God has tested you so that you may follow him or her.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari.
On the authority of Anas bin Malik - may God be pleased with him - he said: I heard the Messenger of God - may God bless him and grant him peace - saying: ((The superiority of Aisha over women is like the superiority of thared over food)); Narrated by the two sheikhs - Al-Bukhari and Muslim. 5- Her worship and asceticism: The Mother of the Believers fasted a lot, until she became weak, as stated in Al-Siyar by Al-Dhahabi - may God Almighty have mercy on him - on the authority of Abdul Rahman bin Al-Qasim, on the authority of his father: that Aisha used to fast all the time. 
She was also ascetic in this world, and she said about her: “The family of Muhammad is not full of whole wheat bread for two days unless one of them is dates”; agreed. On the authority of Ata’: that Muawiyah sent Aisha a necklace worth one hundred thousand, so she divided it among the mothers of the believers, and on the authority of Urwa, on the authority of Aisha: that she gave in charity seventy thousand; She is patching the side of her armor - may God be pleased with her.
On the authority of Umm Dharrah, she said: Ibn al-Zubayr sent Aisha with money in two ghararats, amounting to one hundred thousand, so she called for a plate and began to divide among the people. When evening came, she said: O slave, bring me breakfast. Umm Dharrah said: O Mother of the Believers, could you not buy us meat for a dirham?! She said: Do not scold me. If you had reminded me, I would have done so[2]. 6- Jurisprudence and knowledge of the Mother of the Believers Aisha - may God be pleased with her -: Al-Zuhri said: If Aisha’s knowledge were combined with the knowledge of all women, Aisha’s knowledge would be better[3]. 
God also endowed her with intelligence, acumen, and quick memory. Ibn Katheer said: “There was no one among the nations like Aisha in her memorization, knowledge, eloquence, and mind.” Al-Dhahabi says: “He is the most knowledgeable of the nation’s women at all, and I do not know anyone among the nation of Muhammad, or even among the women.” Absolutely a woman more knowledgeable than her.” The number of hadiths narrated by her exceeded two thousand and one hundred hadiths on the authority of the Prophet - may God bless him and grant him peace - and they are well-known in the books of the Sunnah: Al-Bukhari and Muslim, the Sunans and Musnads, and others. Al-Hafiz Al-Dhahabi said: The Musnad of Aisha consists of two thousand two hundred and ten hadiths. Al-Bukhari and Muslim agreed on one hundred and seventy-four hadiths, Al-Bukhari was alone on fifty-four, and Muslim was alone on sixty-nine[4]. Urwah ibn al-Zubair says: “I have not seen anyone more knowledgeable in jurisprudence, medicine, or poetry than Aisha - may God be pleased with her.” Abu Umar ibn Abdul-Barr said about her: “Aisha was alone in her time in three sciences: jurisprudence, medicine, and poetry.”
She was also the great reference for the senior companions, especially when they were speaking and speaking, and she used to issue fatwas with the knowledge and jurisprudence she had during the era of Caliph Omar and Uthman - may God be pleased with them - until she died - may God have mercy on her and be pleased with her. 7- The revelation of her innocence from the Al-Fak incident from God Almighty: She was exposed - may God be pleased with her - to a severe trial and great temptation, where her honor was challenged and hypocrites disgraced her in Medina, so God sent down her innocence from above the seven heavens, and she said - may God be pleased with her - as in the two Sahih books: “... Then I turned around and lay down on my bed, and God knows that I was innocent at that time, and that God absolved me of my innocence, but by God I did not think that God would send down a revelation about me that would be recited, as my matter about myself was too despicable for God to speak about a matter about me, but I was hoping that the Messenger of God - may God bless him and grant him peace - would see it. And peace be upon him - in sleep, I had a vision in which God would exonerate me. By God, the Messenger of God - may God bless him and grant him peace - did not miss his meeting, nor did any of the people of the house leave until it was revealed to him, so he took hold of him as he used to take from the comfort. To the point that he descended from him by race, like the Juman, and he was in a state of dissatisfaction one day due to the weight of the word that was revealed to him.
She said: Then the Messenger of God - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - walked away while he was laughing, and the first word he spoke was that he said: ((O Aisha, as for God, he has exonerated you)). She said: My mother said to me: Go to him, so I said: By God, I will not stand up to him, for I only thank God. Glory be to Him.
She said: And God Almighty revealed: “Indeed, those who brought immorality are a group of you” [Al-Nour: 11] the verses...\”. Ibn Katheer said: “So God was jealous of her and revealed her innocence in ten verses to be recited over time, so He exalted her remembrance and exalted her status, so that she could hear of her chastity while she was young, so God bore witness to her that she was one of the good women, and promised her forgiveness and generous provision.” 
And with this high status, and the high and pure disavowal of God Almighty, she humbles herself and says: “And I have a more insignificant concern for myself than for God to send down to me a recited Qur’an”! 8- Characteristics of the Mother of the Believers - may God be pleased with her -: Ibn Al-Qayyim - may God have mercy on him - said: 
Among her characteristics is that she was the most beloved of the wives of the Messenger of God - may God bless him and grant him peace - as was proven from him in Al-Bukhari and others. He was asked: Which people are most beloved to you? He said: ((Aisha)). It was said: Who are the men? He said: ((Her father)). Among its characteristics also is that he did not marry a virgin woman other than her, and among its characteristics is that the revelation came to him while he was in her quilt and not on anyone else, and among its characteristics is that when God - the Mighty and Majestic - revealed to him the verse of choice, He began with her and gave her the choice, and said: ((And you should not be in a hurry until you consult your parents)). She said: Is this what I ask my parents about?! For I want God and His Messenger and the Hereafter. So follow the example of the rest of his wives - may God bless him and grant him peace - and say as she said. Among its characteristics is that God Almighty exonerated her from what the people of immorality accused her of, and revealed about her excuse and innocence a revelation that will be recited in the shrines of Muslims and their prayers until the Day of Resurrection. He testified for her that she was one of the good things, and promised her forgiveness and generous provision, and God Almighty told her that what was said about her regarding immorality was good. For her, and what was said about her was not evil for her, nor shameful for her, nor lowered her status. Rather, God exalted her through that, raised her status, magnified her status, and became a reminder of her goodness and innocence among the people of earth and heaven. What a glorious feat! 
Among her characteristics - may God be pleased with her - is that the greatest of the Companions - may God be pleased with them - if they were in doubt about a matter of religion, would ask her for a fatwa and find that she knew it.
Among her characteristics - may God be pleased with her - is that the Messenger of God - may God bless him and grant him peace - died in her house, on her day, between dawn and sacrifice, and was buried in her house. Among her characteristics - may God be pleased with her - is that people were eager to use their gifts on that day from the Messenger of God - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - to draw closer to the Messenger - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - so they would decorate him with whatever he liked in the home of his most beloved women - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him and may God be pleased with them all [5]. Imam Badr al-Din al-Zarkashi said in “The Answer to Narrate What Aisha said about the Companions” - while speaking about her characteristics, may God be pleased with her - the forty, he said: “And the fifth - that is: among the characteristics -: the descent of her innocence from heaven according to what the people of Ifk attributed to her in sixteen successive verses, and it was attested that she was one of The good things, and his promise of forgiveness and generous provision. He said: And the sixth: He made it a Qur’an to be recited until the Day of Resurrection, meaning: the verses that were revealed in its innocence. He said - at the tenth -: It is obligatory for everyone to love her. In the Sahih it is: When Fatima - may God be pleased with her - came to the Prophet - may God bless him and grant him peace - he said to her: ((Don’t you love what I love?)) She said: Yes, he said: ((Then love this one - meaning: Aisha)), and this matter is clearly obligatory. He said - at the eleventh hour -: Whoever slanders it has disbelieved. Because the Holy Qur’an declared her innocence, and said - at the age of twelve -: Whoever denies that her father, Abu Bakr Al-Siddiq - may God be pleased with him - was a companion, is an infidel. This was stated by Al-Shafi’i, for God Almighty says: “When they were in the cave, when he said to his companion, ‘No. “Do not grieve, for God is with us.” [At-Tawbah: 40], and whoever denies the company of someone other than the truthful one will be declared a disbeliever because he disbelieves in the Tawātīr[6]; Ended briefly. 9- Her death - may God be pleased with her -: She died - may God be pleased with her and be pleased with her - in the year fifty-seven according to the correct view, and it was said: the year fifty-eight, on the night of Tuesday the seventeenth of Ramadan that had passed after Witr, and she was buried that night, and Abu Hurairah prayed over her, after she had lived for sixty-three years and months - as Al-Dhahabi mentioned in “Al-Sir”[7]. 10- The Islamic ruling on someone who insults the Mother of the Believers, Aisha - may God be pleased with her -: God Almighty said regarding the praise and status of the Mother of the Believers and other wives of the Prophet - may God bless him and grant him peace -: “The Prophet has more right to the believers than their own selves and their wives.” Their mothers” [Al-Ahzab: 6]. All Islamic scholars from the Sunnis and the community have unanimously agreed that whoever insults the Mother of the Believers Aisha - may God be pleased with her - and accuses her of something that God has cleared her of is an infidel. It was narrated on the authority of Malik bin Anas that he said: Whoever insults Abu Bakr and Omar will be flogged, and whoever insults Aisha will be killed, he will be told: Why? He kills Aisha? Malik said: Whoever throws it has violated the Qur’an, and whoever violates the Qur’an will be killed. Abu Muhammad Ibn Hazm Al-Zahiri - may God have mercy on him - said: This saying of Malik is correct, and it is complete apostasy, and a denial of God Almighty’s assertion of her innocence.
Abu Al-Khattab Ibn Dihiya said in Answers to Questions: The Book of God bears witness to the words of Malik, for when God mentions in the Qur’an what the polytheists attribute to Him, He praises Himself to Himself. The Almighty said: “And they say, ‘The Most Merciful has taken a son. Glory be to Him.’” [The Prophets: 26], And God Almighty mentioned Aisha, He said: “And had you not said, “It is not for us that we should speak of this, Glory be to You, this is a great slander” [An-Nour: 16]. So he praised himself for his integrity. Aisha, just as he praised himself for his integrity; It was narrated by Judge Abu Bakr Ibn al-Tayyib[8]. 
Abu Bakr ibn Ziyad al-Naysaburi said: I heard al-Qasim ibn Muhammad saying to Ismail ibn Ishaq: Two men were brought to al-Ma’mun in Raqqa, one of whom had insulted Fatima and the other Aisha, so he ordered the killing of the one who insulted Fatima and left the other. Ismail said: Their only ruling is that they be killed. Because the one who insulted Aisha rejected the Qur’an. 

Sheikh Al-Islam Ibn Taymiyyah - may God have mercy on him - said in response to him: And the history of the people of jurisprudence and knowledge, from the Ahl al-Bayt and others, proceeded on this.
Ibn al-Arabi - may God have mercy on him - said: Anyone who curses her with something that God has cleared her of is a liar to God, and whoever denies God is an unbeliever.
Ibn Qudamah said: Whoever slanders her with something that God has absolved her of has disbelieved in God Almighty. Imam Al-Nawawi - may God have mercy on him - said: Aisha’s innocence - may God be pleased with her - from falsehood, and it is a definitive innocence according to the text of the Mighty Qur’an, so if a person doubts it - God forbid - he becomes an infidel and apostate according to the consensus of Muslims. 
Ibn al-Qayyim - may God have mercy on him - said: The nation agreed on the blasphemy of those who slandered it. It was narrated on the authority of Amr bin Ghalib: That a man had sexual intercourse with Aisha in Ammar’s presence, and he said: Go away in disgrace. Are you harming the beloved of the Messenger of God - may God bless him and grant him peace?! Al-Dhahabi said in Al-Siyar: Al-Tirmidhi authenticated it in some versions, and in some versions he said: This is a hasan hadith.

• عن علي بن أبي طالب -رضي الله عنه- عن رسول الله -صلى الله عليه وسلم- أنه كان إذا قام إلى الصلاة قال: وجهت وجهي للذي فطر السماوات والأرض حنيفا وما أنا من المشركين، إن صلاتي ونسكي ومحياي ومماتي لله رب العالمين، لا شريك له وبذلك أمرت وأنا من المسلمين، اللهم أنت الملك لا إله إلا أنت، أنت ربي وأنا عبدك، ظلمت نفسي واعترفت بذنبي، فاغفر لي ذنوبي جميعا، إنه لا يغفر الذنوب إلا أنت، واهدني لأحسن الأخلاق، لا يهدي لأحسنها إلا أنت، واصرف عني سيئها، لا يصرف عني سيئها إلا أنت، لبيك وسعديك والخير، كله في يديك، والشر ليس إليك، أنا بك وإليك، تباركت وتعاليت، أستغفرك وأتوب إليك.
وإذا ركع قال: اللهم لك ركعت، وبك آمنت، ولك أسلمت، خشع لك سمعي وبصري ومخي وعظمي وعصبي.
وإذا رفع قال: اللهم ربنا لك الحمد ملء السماوات، وملء الأرض، وملء ما بينهما، وملء ما شئت من شيء بعد.
وإذا سجد قال: اللهم لك سجدت، وبك آمنت، ولك أسلمت، سجد وجهي للذي خلقه وصوره وشق سمعه وبصره، تبارك الله أحسن الخالقين.
ثم يكون من آخر ما يقول بين التشهد والتسليم: اللهم اغفر لي ما قدمت وما أخرت، وما أسررت وما أعلنت، وما أسرفت، وما أنت أعلم به مني، أنت المقدم وأنت المؤخر، لا إله إلا أنت.

• عن ابن عباس -رضي الله عنهما- قال كان النبي -صلى الله عليه وسلم- إذا قام من الليل يتهجد، قال: اللهم لك الحمد أنت قيم السماوات والأرض ومن فيهن، ولك الحمد لك ملك السماوات والأرض ومن فيهن، ولك الحمد أنت نور السماوات والأرض ومن فيهن، ولك الحمد أنت ملك السماوات والأرض، ولك الحمد أنت الحق ووعدك الحق ولقاؤك حق وقولك حق، والجنة حق والنار حق والنبيون حق ومحمد -صلى الله عليه وسلم- حق والساعة حق، اللهم لك أسلمت، وبك آمنت، وعليك توكلت، وإليك أنبت، وبك خاصمت، وإليك حاكمت، فاغفر لي ما قدمت وما أخرت، وما أسررت وما أعلنت، أنت المقدم وأنت المؤخر، لا إله إلا أنت ولا حول ولا قوة إلا بالله
البخاري كتاب الجمعة برقم 1053

• عن عائشة -رضي الله عنها- قالت: كان النبي -صلى الله عليه وسلم- إذا عصفت الريح، قال: اللهم إني أسألك خيرها وخير ما فيها وخير ما أرسلت به، وأعوذ بك من شرها وشر ما فيها وشر ما أرسلت به. قالت: وإذا تخيلت [تغيمت] السماء تغير لونه وخرج ودخل وأقبل وأدبر، فإذا مطرت سري عنه، فعرفت ذلك في وجهه. قالت عائشة: فسألته، فقال: لعله يا عائشة كما قال قوم عاد: {فلما رأوه عارضا مستقبل أوديتهم قالوا هذا عارض ممطرنا}.

• عن أنس بن مالك -رضي الله عنه- قال: كان النبي -صلى الله عليه وسلم- يكثر أن يقول في دعائه: اللهم آتنا في الدنيا حسنة، وفي الآخرة حسنة، وقنا عذاب النار. 
أحمد ـ المسند (صحيح) حديث 4802 صحيح الجامع

• عن زيد ابن أرقم -رضي الله عنه- قال: لا أقول لكم إلا كما كان رسول الله -صلى الله عليه وسلم- يقول، كان يقول: اللهم إني أعوذ بك من العجز والكسل، والجبن والبخل والهرم وعذاب القبر، اللهم آت نفسي تقواها، وزكها أنت خير من زكاها، أنت وليها ومولاها، اللهم إني أعوذ بك من علم لا ينفع، ومن قلب لا يخشع، ومن نفس لا تشبع، ومن دعوة لا يستجاب لها. 
مسلم، كتاب الذكر والدعاء والتوبة والاستغفار برقم4899 .
number-en:
The Master of Servants, may God bless him and grant him peace
In the name of God, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful
label-en:
• The Prophet - may God bless him and grant him peace - used to remember God at all times. 
Al-Bukhari - Book of Menstruation

• On the authority of Hudhayfah - may God be pleased with him - who said that when the Prophet - may God bless him and grant him peace - was at his party, he commanded him to pray.
(Hasan) Abu Dawud - 4703 Sahih Al-Jami’. ‌

• On the authority of Al-Mughirah - may God be pleased with him - he said: If the Prophet - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - were to stand up to pray until his feet or legs were wet, he would be told, and he would say: Shall I not be a grateful servant? Al-Bukhari, Friday Book, No. 1062

• On the authority of Ibn Omar - may God be pleased with them both - he said that the Prophet - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - would pray while traveling on his mount, wherever he was heading, gesticulating [pointing with his head] like the night prayer, except for the obligatory prayers, and praying the Witr prayer on his mount. 
Al-Bukhari, Friday Book, No. 945

• On the authority of Aisha - may God be pleased with her - she said that when the Prophet - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - began the prayer, he would say: Glory be to You, O God, and with Your praise, and blessed be Your name, and exalted is Your grandfather, and there is no god but You. (Hasan Sahih) Al-Tirmidhi - Book of Prayer No. 226

• On the authority of Ali bin Abi Talib - may God be pleased with him - on the authority of the Messenger of God - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - that when he stood up to pray, he said: I turn my face to the One who created the heavens and the earth, as a Hanif, and I am not of the polytheists. Indeed, my prayer and rituals, my life and my death belong to God, Lord of the worlds, with no partner, and thus I have commanded and I am one of the Muslims. Oh God, you are the king, there is no god but you, you are my Lord and I am your servant. I wronged myself and confessed my sin, so forgive me for all my sins. All sins are forgiven except You, and guide me to the best of morals. No one guides to the best of morals except You, and turn away from me the bad ones. No one can turn my evil away from me except You. I am Yours and Your happiness, and goodness is all in Your hands, and evil is not Yours. I am through You and to You. I am blessed and exalted. I seek Your forgiveness and repent to You.
And when he bows, he says: Oh God, to You I kneeled, and to You I believed, and to You I submitted, my hearing, my sight, my brain, my bones, and my nerves submit to You.
And when he raises himself, he says: O God, our Lord, to You is praise that fills the heavens, fills the earth, fills what is between them, and fills whatever you want after that.
And when he prostrates, he says: Oh God, I prostrate to You, and in You I believe, and to You I submit. My face prostrates to the One who created it and shaped it and created its hearing and sight. Blessed be God, the best of creators. Then one of the last things he says between the Tashahhud and the salutation is: O God, forgive me for what I have put forward and what I have delayed, what I have concealed and what I have declared, what I have been extravagant with, and what You know better than me. You are the one who advances and you are the one who delays, there is no god but You.
Muslim - Book of Travelers’ Prayer and its Shortening, No. 1290

• On the authority of Ibn Abbas - may God be pleased with them both - he said that when the Prophet - may God bless him and grant him peace - got up at night, he would say: O God, praise be to You, You are the ruler of the heavens and the earth and those in them, and praise be to You, the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and those in them, and praise be to You, you are the light of the heavens and the earth and those in them, and praise be to You, you are the king of the heavens and the earth, Praise be to You, You are the truth, Your promise is true, meeting You is true, Your words are true, Paradise is true, Hell is true, the prophets are true, Muhammad - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - is true, and the Hour is true. Oh God, to You I have submitted, and in You I have believed, and in You I have put my trust, and to You I return, and to You I have disputed, and to You I have judged, so forgive me for what I have put forward and what I have delayed, and what I have concealed and what I have declared, You are the advancer and you are the latter. There is no god but You and there is no power nor strength except in God.
Al-Bukhari, Friday Book, No. 1053

• On the authority of Aisha - may God be pleased with her - she said: Whenever the Messenger of God - may God bless him and grant him peace - performed a deed, he would prove it, and if he slept at night or was sick, he would pray twelve rak’ahs during the day. She said: I never saw the Messenger of God - may God bless him and grant him peace - praying one night until the morning, and he did not fast for a consecutive month except Ramadan.
Muslim - Book of Travelers’ Prayer and its Shortening, No. 1235

• Abdullah bin Al-Zubayr - may God be pleased with him - used to say on the pulpit: When the Prophet - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - left the prayer, he would say: There is no god but God alone, with no partner, to Him belongs dominion and to Him is praise, and He is capable of all things. There is no god but God, sincere in religion to Him, even if the disbelievers hate it. People of grace, grace, and good praise. There is no god but God, sincere in religion, even if the disbelievers hate it. Muslim, Abu Dawud - Prayer Book No. 1288

• On the authority of Abu Salama bin Abdul Rahman that he asked Aisha - may God be pleased with her - how was the prayer of the Messenger of God - may God bless him and grant him peace - in Ramadan? She said: The Messenger of God - may God bless him and grant him peace - did not exceed eleven rak’ahs in Ramadan or at any other time. He would pray four, so do not worry about their beauty and length. Then he would pray four, so do not worry about their beauty and length, then he would pray three. Aisha said: So I said: O Messenger of God, do you sleep before praying the Witr prayer? He said: O Aisha, my eyes sleep but my heart does not sleep.
Al-Bukhari - Friday Book No. 1079

• On the authority of Aisha - may God be pleased with her - she said: When the Prophet - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - began, he would tighten his apron, spend the night, and wake up his family. 
Al-Bukhari - Tarawih Prayer Book No. 1884

• On the authority of Abu Hurairah - may God be pleased with him - he said: The Prophet - may God bless him and grant him peace - used to seclude ten days every Ramadan, but when the year in which he died came, he secluded twenty days. Al-Bukhari - Book of Itikaf No. 1903

• On the authority of Abdullah bin Omar - may God be pleased with them both - he said: When the Prophet - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - returned from Hajj or Umrah - and I do not know him except that he said conquest - he would say whenever he fulfilled a fold or reached [the one who was raised from the ground], he would say “Allahu Akbar” three times, then he would say: There is no god but God alone, with no partner, to Him belongs the dominion and to Him is praise, and He is powerful over all things. Abduh was victorious and defeated the parties alone. Al-Bukhari - Book of Jihad and Path No. 2773

• On the authority of Aisha - may God be pleased with her - she said: When the wind blew, the Prophet - may God bless him and grant him peace - would say: Oh God, I ask you for its good, the good of what is in it, and the good of what you were sent with, and I seek refuge in you from its evil, the evil of what is in it, and the evil of what you were sent with. She said: And if I imagined that the sky was cloudy, it would change its colour, and he would go out and come in, and come and go, and if it rained, I would hide from him, and I recognized that in his face. Aisha said: So I asked him, and he said: Perhaps, O Aisha, it is as the people of Aad said: {And when they saw it projecting towards their valleys, they said: This is a projecting rainy place}. Muslim - Rain Prayer Book No. 1496

• On the authority of Ibn Abbas - may God be pleased with them both - he said: The Prophet - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - used to supplicate during times of distress, saying: There is no god but God, the Great, the Forbearing, there is no god but God, Lord of the heavens and the earth and Lord of the Great Throne. 
Al-Bukhari - Book of Supplications No. 5869

• On the authority of Ibn Abbas - may God be pleased with them both - he said: The Prophet - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - used to pray, saying: My Lord, help me and do not help me, grant me victory and do not help me, plot for me and do not plot against me, guide me and facilitate guidance for me, and grant me victory over those who oppress me, My Lord, make me grateful to You in remembrance of You, fearful of You [frequent in fear], obedient to You, hidden [submissive and submissive], to You I seek refuge, repentant [submissive and often weeping]. My Lord, accept my repentance, wash away my guilt [sin and wrongdoing], answer my supplication, confirm my proof, guide my tongue, guide my heart, and remove the foulness [of hatred and malice] from my chest. 
Al-Tirmidhi - Book of Supplications (Sahih) Hadith 3485 Sahih Al-Jami’.

• On the authority of Anas bin Malik - may God be pleased with him - he said: The Prophet - may God’s prayers and peace be upon him - would often say in his supplications: Oh God, give us good in this world, and good in the hereafter, and protect us from the torment of the Fire. Ahmed - Al-Musnad (Sahih) Hadith 4802 Sahih Al-Jami’

• On the authority of Zaid Ibn Arqam - may God be pleased with him - he said: I only tell you what the Messenger of God - may God bless him and grant him peace - used to say. He used to say: Oh God, I seek refuge in You from incapacity, laziness, cowardice, miserliness, senility, and the torment of the grave. Oh God, give my soul its piety, and purify it. You are better than those who purify it. You are its guardian and master. Oh God, I seek refuge in You from knowledge that is useless, from a heart that is not humble, from a soul that is not satisfied, and from supplication. He doesn't respond to her. 
Muslim, Book of Remembrance, Supplication, Repentance, and Asking Forgiveness, No. 4899.
